questions.uddipok: The pie chart shows different sports and the percentage of people like them. Now describe the chart highlighting the main points in about 150 words.

sub_questions.explanation:
The pie chart shows the percentage of people who like watching sports like football, cricket, volleyball, basketball, tennis, golf and others. According to the chart, 20% of people like watching Football. Then there's Cricket that is liked by 25% of people. It is the most popular sport with the highest percentage number. Volleyball is another interesting sport that 15% of people like watching whereas 10% of people like watching Basketball. Below the 10% margin stands the sports Tennis and Golf. The chart shows that 8% of people like watching Tennis and on the other hand, 7% of people like watching Golf. Lastly, there are 15% of people who like watching other sports. In short, the chart implies that people like watching various sports for entertainment
where cricket is the most popular game and football is next to it.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of the following story and complete it in your own way. Give a suitable title to the story:
There was a naughty cowboy who grazed his cows beside a forest. He used to make fun with people crying Tiger! Tiger!.........

sub_questions.explanation:
Once there was a cowboy. He used to graze cow in the field. There was a forest beside the field. There lived tigers in the forest. The boy was very naughty. He went to the filed to feed the cow. He used to pastime there alone. To make fan, the cowboy used to shout uttering tiger, tiger and the people of nearby locality would come to save him. Seeing them, the cowboy started laughing. The people understood his trick, become bored and went away.
By the way, the boy used to continue his work in the field. One day, when he was grazing the cows in the field, a tiger come truly. He became afraid and started shouting for help to save him life. The people thought that he was making fan again. They did not pay heed to him. Nobody came to save him. Everyone thought that he was making fan with them as usual. The tiger attack the cattle and killed the boy. The boy lost his life for telling lies; He realized at last that if a liar speaks truth, nobody believes it. We can understand from the story that nobody trusts a liar.

questions.uddipok: Write a letter to your brother describing the importance of reading newspaper.

sub_questions.explanation:
Feni
04.07.2024
Dear Mijanur,
Hey! How are things going at college? I'm writing to you today because I wanted to talk about something important – reading newspapers.
I know you might not be a big fan of sitting down with a physical paper these days, but trust me, there are a lot of benefits to be had from this "old-fashioned" habit.
Firstly, newspapers keep you informed. They give you a well-rounded view of current events, both locally and internationally. It's important to stay up-to-date on what's happening in the world, not just through social media, which can be filled with rumors and biased opinions. Newspapers offer a more reliable source of information.
Secondly, reading newspapers improves your vocabulary and communication skills. They're full of rich, descriptive language, and you'll be exposed to new words and writing styles. This can definitely help you improve your own writing and speaking abilities.
Thirdly, newspapers challenge your mind and keep it sharp. Reading articles on various topics, from politics and science to sports and entertainment, engages your brain in a different way. It's a good mental exercise and helps you stay mentally stimulated.
Finally, newspapers can even introduce you to new interests. You might stumble upon an article about something you never knew existed, sparking a new passion or hobby.
I know you're busy with classes and other activities, but even just skimming through the headlines or reading a few articles a day can make a big difference. Maybe there's a section you'd find particularly interesting, like sports or technology? You could even consider subscribing to a digital version of a newspaper for easier access.
Give it a try, [Brother's Name]! I think you might be surprised at how much you learn and enjoy it.
Let me know what you think if you decide to check it out.
Best,
Harun

questions.uddipok:
Write a summary of the following passage :

Sheikh Kamal knew that there is no shortcut to success. He groomed himself up as a young man who earned success by dint of perseverance and commitment. When the Pakistan military began its genocide in Bangladesh, he joined the Liberation War and received military training at Camp Murtee located at the Himalayan foothills in India. The tall young man who carried himself with dignity and possessed remarkable traits of leadership became the ADC of General Ataul Goni, Osmani, the Commander in Chief of Bangladesh Armed Forces during the Liberation War. After Independence, Sheikh Kamal could, easily remain in Bangladesh Army and pass a secure life but he preferred to engage himself in country building and organizing the young forces to that end, Journalist Syed Ishtiaq Rezi in one of his columns 'Ekjon Sheikh Kamal' in Bangla Tribune rightly says that the unique qualities of Sheikh Kamal's character, especially his wholehearted involvement in sports and culture are never seen in any son or daughter of any President, Prime Minister or High Officials in Bangladesh.

sub_questions.explanation: Sheikh Kamal exemplified perseverance and commitment, earning success through hard work. He joined the Liberation War during the Pakistan military's genocide in Bangladesh, receiving military training in India and serving as ADC to General Osmani. After independence, instead of pursuing a secure military career, he focused on nation-building and youth organization. Renowned for his involvement in sports and culture, his unique qualities distinguished him from other political figures' offspring in Bangladesh, as noted by journalist Syed Ishtiaq Rezi

questions.uddipok:
Write a summary of the following passage.
Education aims to bring about positive changes in our behavior. It helps us try to change our lives as well as the society we live in. Education that does not illuminate our minds or does not inspire us to work for the community is not complete at all. Education is not all about getting grades or receiving certificates- we use education to make life better. We are expected to apply the knowledge, skills and values that we learn in a classroom in our engagement with the world that lies outside. And we can do so in many different ways. Let's have a look at how education works. Learners' civic engagement is highly appreciated all over the world. Civic engagement means working to make a difference in the civic life (the public life of the citizens as constructed with private or personal life) of the community using knowledge, skills, values and motivation. Civic engagement promotes the quality of life in a community by contributing to the improvement of health and wellbeing of the people.
Civically engaged individuals recognize themselves as members of a larger social community and are concerned about civic issues. They consider themselves responsible citizens who take action or raise their voices against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills.
In civic engagement, issues of public concern are crucial. Civic engagement includes individual or group activities to protect public interests and change the way the community values itself. For example, If you are protesting against any unjust decision of the local municipality such as raising taxes or an act that might work against people's interests, you are civically engaged and your action is considered a civic engagement. This protest can be done in different ways such as organizing rallies, collecting signatures, making human chains, writing petitions, etc. You can also help control traffic in front of a school, help children to cross the roads, work in a team to clean a park or a sea beach. You can also give some services to elderly people. These are all examples of civic engagement as what you do directly affects the community.
When civic engagement is a part of an academic program, and the learners' engagement is assessed following a scale, then it is called service learning. It involves the application of knowledge and skills learned in the classroom and then making a complete plan of action 1.e. preparing a budget, starting the process of implementation, involving people and activating operational strategies.

sub_questions.explanation: Education plays a vital role in bringing about positive changes in behaviour. It helps us try to change our life as well as our society. Complete education not only illuminates our minds but also inspires us to work for the community. The purpose of education is not getting grades and receiving certificates. The main objective of education is to make life better. Civic engagement of the learners is highly appreciated all over the world nowadays. A civically engaged person works to create a difference in the civic life taking action or raising voice against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills. When we work for social welfare, we are civically engaged. Civic engagement may be individual or group activities. For example, we can raise voice against raising excessive taxes. This protest can be done by organising ralles, collecting signature, making human chains, etc. Learners engagement is evaluated by following a scale. Rnowledge and skills learned in the school is applied. in society for public welfare.

Meditation releases anxiety and brings a state of calmness. It increases the thinking ability of human brain so that people have a better control of their emotions. Those who practice meditation can work tirelessly for a longer period of time. Meditation helps improve blood circulation in the brain and other parts of the body. questions.uddipok:
Rearrange the following jumbled sentences in proper sequence:
(a) Enemies invaded his kingdom.
(b) He had to flee from his kingdom to save his life and so he took shelter in a remote cave.
(c) Once while lying in the cave, he saw a spider trying hard to reach the ceiling of the cave.
(d) Robert Bruce was a famous king of Scotland.
(e) The king was always in a gloomy state for his unhappy condition.
(f) The king fought bravely but lost his battle.
(g) He gathered an army of strong men and attacked his enemies.
(h) The enemies were defeated and Robert Bruce regained his kingdom.
(i) Bruce saw the spider climbing to the ceiling after some unsuccessful attempts.
(j) The spider failed several times, but it did not give up hope.

sub_questions.explanation:
(d)→(a)→(f)→(b)→(e)→(c)→(j)→(i)→(g) → (h)
Robert Bruce was a famous king of Scotland. Enemies invaded his kingdom. The king fought bravely but lost his battle. He had to flee from his kingdom to save his life and so he took shelter in a remote cave. The king was always in a gloomy state for his unhappy condition. Once, while lying in the cave he saw a spider trying hard to reach the ceiling of the cave. The spider failed several times but it did not give up hope. Bruce saw the spider climbing to the ceiling after some unsuccessful attempts. He gathered an army of strong men and attacked his enemies. The enemies were defeated and Robert Bruce regained his kingdom.
